Inference: Confirming true water presence via tri-signal agreement
Description: When moisture rises, flow anomalies occur, and temperatures shift simultaneously, the system can confirm the presence of actual water movement rather than sensor noise.
short rationale: Triangulated incident confirmation; strong reconstruction potential.

Inference: Distinguishing condensation from plumbing leaks
Description: Moisture increases at low temperatures without corresponding flow anomalies indicate condensation, whereas moisture plus flow anomalies confirms plumbing leaks.
short rationale: Separates condensation vs. leaks; moderate context sensitivity.

Inference: Identifying freeze-induced partial blockages
Description: Low temperatures with reduced flow anomalies and rising moisture indicate partial ice blockage causing seepage rather than full pipe rupture.
short rationale: Freeze-related partial blockage signals; moderate incident specificity.

Inference: Detecting freeze–thaw seepage precursors
Description: Sustained sub-freezing temperatures followed by small flow anomalies and early moisture rise represent precursors to freeze-induced leaks.
short rationale: Precursors tied to temperature and timing; reconstruction risk.

Inference: Classifying burst vs. seep leaks using flow–moisture dynamics
Description: High flow anomalies with rapid moisture rise and temperature extremes indicate burst leaks, while small anomalies with gradual moisture increase imply seepage.
short rationale: Classifies severity/type with timing; strong incident fingerprint.

Inference: Estimating leak rate using flow–moisture patterns under temperature effects
Description: Combining flow anomaly magnitude, moisture accumulation rate, and thermal context improves estimation of leak severity and progression.
short rationale: Quantifies severity with temperature context; detailed reconstruction.

Inference: Identifying non-plumbing water ingress
Description: Moisture spikes without flow anomalies at normal temperatures suggest external ingress such as rainfall, drainage failure, or spills.
short rationale: External ingress identification; moderate location/timing sensitivity.

Inference: Evaluating insulation effectiveness through thermal–moisture correlation
Description: Zones showing moisture rise and flow anomalies only during temperature extremes reveal insulation weaknesses.
short rationale: Maps insulation gaps by zone; location/history sensitive.

Inference: Detecting leaks masked in high-demand periods
Description: Small flow anomalies hidden under large baseline usage can still be detected when temperature anomalies and moisture increases align.
short rationale: Finds leaks during high usage; moderate sensitivity.

Inference: Assessing cold-weather risk zones
Description: Moisture elevation and flow anomalies repeatedly occurring at low temperatures identify cold-sensitive plumbing areas.
short rationale: Cold-risk zones with multi-signal evidence; location-sensitive.

Inference: Ranking zones by thermal sensitivity to leaks
Description: Zones where leaks consistently occur alongside temperature extremes and moisture rise can be classified as thermally vulnerable.
short rationale: Zone vulnerability ranking; moderate location exposure.

Inference: Differentiating high-viscosity flow behavior in cold conditions
Description: Cold temperatures reduce flow rates; small flow anomalies paired with significant moisture rise indicate restricted but ongoing leakage.
short rationale: Analytical behavior; low incident specificity.

Inference: Detecting overheating-related leaks
Description: Elevated temperatures paired with flow anomalies and moisture rise reveal overheating-induced seal or pipe failures.
short rationale: Overheat leak identification; incident-specific but limited personal inference.

Inference: Analyzing temperature-dependent moisture spread rates
Description: Moisture tends to spread faster at higher temperatures; slow spread despite flow anomalies indicates cooler ambient conditions.
short rationale: Propagation analysis; low privacy impact.

Inference: Identifying stagnant-pooling events
Description: Moisture rise without matching flow anomaly magnitude at stable temperatures suggests water pooling due to insufficient drainage.
short rationale: Pooling detection; moderate sensitivity.

Inference: Recognizing appliance-related anomalies
Description: Flow anomalies with high temperatures but transient moisture indicate appliance discharge rather than structural leaks.
short rationale: Attributes events to appliances; some occupancy signal exposure.

Inference: Inferring leak location using temperature gradients and moisture timing
Description: The earliest moisture rise and strongest temperature deviation during a flow anomaly help pinpoint the leak source.
short rationale: Pinpoints leak source via gradients/timing; high location sensitivity.

Inference: Detecting hidden leaks behind insulated surfaces
Description: Moisture rise plus flow anomalies but minimal temperature deviation implies leaks behind insulated walls or underground.
short rationale: Hidden leak inference; location-specific.

Inference: Validating flow sensor accuracy using moisture–temperature feedback
Description: Repeated moisture and temperature anomalies without flow anomaly detection suggest faulty or insensitive flow sensors.
short rationale: Sensor diagnostic; low privacy exposure.

Inference: Characterizing multi-factor leak severity progression
Description: Severe leaks show combined signatures of large flow anomalies, rapid moisture accumulation, and strong thermal shifts.
short rationale: Severity profiling with multi-signals; detailed reconstruction.

Inference: Predicting leak escalation using tri-signal trends
Description: Gradual temperature drift plus small flow anomalies and slowly rising moisture can signal an impending escalation into a major leak.
short rationale: Early-warning trends with timing; moderate-to-high sensitivity.

Inference: Thermal profiling for leak type classification
Description: Different leak types—freeze leaks, hot-water leaks, structural seepage—create distinct temperature–flow–moisture profiles.
short rationale: Pattern library for classification; moderate incident detail.

Inference: Identifying leaks suppressed by temperature effects
Description: Cold temperatures may temporarily reduce observable flow but moisture rise still reveals ongoing leakage.
short rationale: Notes ongoing leaks masked by cold; moderate sensitivity.

Inference: Detecting drainage or backflow issues
Description: Moisture rise at stable temperatures without proportional flow anomalies may indicate drainage obstruction rather than supply-side pipe leaks.
short rationale: Cause differentiation; moderate incident detail.

Inference: Learning leak fingerprints from tri-signal interactions
Description: Each incident forms a pattern of temperature slope, moisture evolution, and flow anomaly shape, enabling machine-learned classification of leak types.
short rationale: Pattern library; moderate sensitivity.
